```{python}
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

yarn = pd.read_csv("~/Desktop/16/CS200B/project/final_yarn.csv")
yarn.describe(include = "all")
yarn = pd.DataFrame(yarn)
```

```{python}
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(20, 5))

sns.histplot(data=yarn,
             x='rating_average',
             bins=20, alpha=0.6,
             ax=axes[0])
axes[0].set_title('High Frequency of an Average Rating of 5/5' )
axes[0].set_xlabel('Average Rating of Yarns')
axes[0].set_ylabel('Frequency')

sns.boxplot(data=yarn,
             y='yarn_weight_name',
             x = "rating_average",
             ax=axes[1])
axes[1].set_title('Most yarn weights have a mean average rating around 4.5/5' )
axes[1].set_xlabel('Average Rating of Yarns')
axes[1].set_ylabel('Yarn Weight')
```
